references.paper_title: On the theory of policy gradient methods: Optimality, approximation, and distribution shift
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational theoretical analysis of natural policy gradient methods, which are central to the algorithms developed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Fast global convergence of natural policy gradient methods with entropy regularization
references.reason: This paper establishes the global convergence of entropy-regularized natural policy gradient methods, which serves as the theoretical basis for the entropy-regularized federated NPG algorithm proposed in this work.

references.paper_title: Fast policy extragradient methods for competitive games with entropy regularization
references.reason: This paper develops fast policy extragradient methods for competitive games and provides important algorithmic ideas used in the development of federated NPG algorithms.

references.paper_title: Linear convergence of natural policy gradient methods with log-linear policies
references.reason: This paper analyzes the linear convergence of natural policy gradient methods with log-linear policies under various assumptions, including function approximation, providing crucial theoretical foundations for the convergence results of the proposed federated NAC algorithm.

references.paper_title: Policy mirror descent for reinforcement learning: Linear convergence, new sampling complexity, and generalized problem classes
references.reason: This paper establishes linear convergence rates for policy mirror descent methods in reinforcement learning and provides a general framework for analyzing the convergence and sample complexity, which is important for understanding the performance of the proposed federated NAC algorithm.
